decks.notes: The deck focuses on assembling a powerful combo involving Basking Broodscale, Blade of the Bloodchief, and Glaring Fleshraker to generate a swarm of powerful creatures. It also includes disruptive elements like Kozilek's Command and Malevolent Rumble to control the board and protect the combo pieces. The deck utilizes ramp from Eldrazi Temple and Urza's Saga to quickly assemble its combo pieces, while also including various utility lands and spells like Boseiju, Who Endures and Tezzeret, Cruel Captain to further support the game plan.

The deck focuses on using various discard spells and card draw to dump powerful creatures into the graveyard, only to bring them back into play with reanimation spells like Persist and Unearth. The key idea is to create a quick and explosive combo that allows you to overwhelm your opponent with strong creatures like Emperor of Bones and Archon of Cruelty. The deck also includes disruptive elements like Psychic Frog and Thoughtseize to disrupt your opponent's game plan and ensure your combo goes off smoothly.

This deck focuses on quickly establishing a strong board presence with aggressive creatures like Ragavan, Nimble Pilferer, Scion of Draco, and Territorial Kavu. It uses powerful enchantments like Leyline of Binding and Leyline of the Guildpact to control the battlefield and protect its creatures. The deck also includes spells like Lightning Bolt and Stubborn Denial for removal and counterplay. With a mix of land cards for mana fixing and consistency, this deck aims to overwhelm the opponent with fast, efficient threats while disrupting their game plan.

This Boros Aggro deck focuses on aggressive plays and efficient creatures to quickly overwhelm the opponent. It aims to establish a strong board presence early on with cards like Ajani, Nacatl Pariah and Ragavan, Nimble Pilferer, while also utilizing cards like Galvanic Discharge and Goblin Bombardment for removal and direct damage. The deck also includes some control elements like Static Prison and Elegant Parlor to disrupt the opponent's strategy. Overall, this deck emphasizes fast, aggressive plays combined with some control elements to maintain pressure on the opponent.

The deck focuses on quickly deploying a wide array of artifacts onto the field to overwhelm the opponent through aggressive plays. By using cards like Mox Opal and Mishra's Bauble to ramp up mana quickly, the deck aims to control the board with cards like Engineered Explosives and Metallic Rebuke while keeping up card advantage with cards like Thoughtcast and Expressive Iteration. Emry, Lurker of the Loch and Tamiyo, Inquisitive Student also provide additional utility and value to the deck, making it a fast-paced and versatile aggro deck with a heavy artifact focus.

This deck focuses on utilizing artifact synergies and ramping up quickly to overwhelm the opponent with a swarm of creatures and powerful artifacts. It aims to quickly establish a strong board presence while disrupting the opponent's strategy with cards like Sink into Stupor and Tormod's Crypt. By utilizing cards like Mox Opal and Urza's Saga, the deck is able to generate mana quickly and consistently to cast powerful threats like Emry, Lurker of the Loch and Thought Monitor. Overall, the deck seeks to be proactive, aggressive, and disruptive in order to secure a fast victory.

The deck focuses on quickly deploying cheap artifacts and creatures to overwhelm the opponent with aggressive plays. By leveraging the synergy between artifacts and creatures, along with ways to generate mana and card advantage, this deck aims to put pressure on the opponent early and force them to react. Additionally, the inclusion of disruptive elements like Tormod's Crypt and Engineered Explosives allows the deck to disrupt the opponent's game plan while continuing to push for an early victory.

This deck revolves around utilizing Amulet of Vigor and Primeval Titan to quickly generate mana and search for key lands such as Urza's Saga and Vesuva. By carefully managing land drops and utilizing cards like Arboreal Grazer and Simic Growth Chamber, the deck can quickly reach its combo pieces and overwhelm the opponent with powerful synergies. The inclusion of cards like Scapeshift and Lotus Field provide additional ways to generate mana and close out the game efficiently. The deck also features a number of utility lands and spells to provide flexibility and resilience in different situations.

The deck focuses on assembling a powerful combo without using any lands. By utilizing cards like Lotus Bloom and Whir of Invention, the player can quickly search for key pieces like Goblin Charbelcher and Hydroelectric Specimen to create a devastating win condition. With a mix of disruptive spells like Disrupting Shoal and Force of Negation, along with card draw options like Sea Gate Restoration and Waterlogged Teachings, the deck aims to control the game while setting up its combo finish. The key is to efficiently search, protect, and execute the combo to overwhelm the opponent.

The main concept of this Boros Aggro deck is to overwhelm the opponent with a combination of aggressive creatures and burn spells. By playing efficient threats like Ragavan, Nimble Pilferer and Guide of Souls, the deck aims to quickly reduce the opponent's life total. The inclusion of cards like Goblin Bombardment and Galvanic Discharge allows for additional reach and removal options to maintain pressure on the opponent. The deck also utilizes cards like Ajani, Nacatl Pariah and Ocelot Pride to generate value and create advantageous board states. Additionally, cards like Blood Moon and Voice of Victory can disrupt the opponent's game plan and provide additional closing power.

The main concept of this UW Control deck is to establish control over the game through counterspells, removal, and card advantage provided by planeswalkers like Narset and Teferi. The deck aims to disrupt the opponent's game plan, maintain board control with sweepers like Supreme Verdict, and eventually win through card advantage and efficient threats. The inclusion of Kaheera as a companion adds an additional threat and synergizes well with the deck's control elements. The deck also utilizes powerful sideboard options like Prismatic Ending to deal with a variety of threats in the Modern format.

This deck aims to quickly flood the board with cheap artifacts, utilizing cards like Memnite and Kappa Cannoneer to overwhelm the opponent. Emry, Lurker of the Loch and Urza's Saga provide additional value by recurring artifacts and generating more threats. The deck also includes disruptive elements like Tormod's Crypt and Metallic Rebuke to control the game. With a focus on tempo and aggression, it seeks to establish a commanding presence early on and close out the game before the opponent can stabilize.

This UR Aggro deck focuses on quickly overwhelming opponents with aggressive creatures like Dragon's Rage Channeler and Monastery Swiftspear, while utilizing burn spells like Lightning Bolt and Lava Dart to clear the way for damage. It also includes cards that allow for card selection and card advantage, such as Preordain and Expressive Iteration. The deck aims to apply pressure early in the game and maintain a fast pace throughout, using a mix of creatures and burn spells to push the opponent to zero life as quickly as possible.

This deck focuses on utilizing Leyline cards to control the game and maximize the benefits of playing multiple colors. By playing aggressive creatures like Ragavan and Territorial Kavu, paired with powerful spells like Lightning Bolt and Stubborn Denial, it aims to quickly overwhelm the opponent and finish the game efficiently. The inclusion of Fable of the Mirror-Breaker and Scion of Draco provides additional versatility and power to the deck, making it a challenging opponent for any Modern 1 vs 1 matchup.

The deck focuses on utilizing powerful creatures like Scion of Draco, Phlage Titan of Fire's Fury, and Ragavan, Nimble Pilferer to apply early pressure and quickly overwhelm the opponent. The Leyline cards help increase the efficiency and power of the creatures, while cards like Lightning Bolt and Stubborn Denial provide disruption and protection. Arena of Glory acts as a finisher, allowing the deck to close out games quickly. Overall, the key concept of the deck is to establish a strong board presence early on and maintain pressure throughout the game to secure a swift victory.

The deck focuses on filling your graveyard with powerful creatures and then bringing them back onto the battlefield for devastating combos. It utilizes a mix of self-mill cards, reanimation spells, and disruptive cards to control the game until you can unleash your creatures for a game-ending combo. The deck aims to quickly set up its combo pieces and disrupt the opponent's game plan to secure a victory.
